title: Boards: Quoting & Reply Update

embed.description: I can't wait to see Cass rework actually be deemed powerful by everyone else besides the boards

body:
Hi All,

Welcome to another Boards update. Quoting edition! 

This has been probably one of our most requested feature updates. Quoting before had been a painful experience, with little to no context and weird issues around nested quotes. Those things should now be resolved with our new shiny rollout. 

**Quoting / Reply Changes:**

* References the person it quoted 
* Displays a timestamp 
* Links back to the originally quoted comment
* If the quote / reply is made in Chronological view it will transfer (properly threaded) into Discussion view
* Visual updates to make it clear and less obnoxious

Please let us know if you experience any bugs or issues with the new system. Looking forward to your questions or comments below!

---

**Ongoing List of Boards Work!**

* ~~Quoting & Replying Update~~ — DONE
* ~~Character Limit Evaluation (Comments + Discussion)~~ — DONE
* Formatting Update — *In progress*
* Improvements to Comments — *In progress, part 1 rollout done*
* Update to the Red Tracker
* Pagination / Endless Scrolling
* Bug Fixes — *Ongoing*
* Continued Clarity Adjustments — *In Progress*
* Search improvements — *Round 1 In Progress*
* Mobile improvements 
* Add new items from Feedback thread — *In Progress*

Why did you decide to make the timestamp code repeat in the text itself?

I mean I can do things like

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sweet,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=oOJGXBnK,comment-id=,timestamp=1996-10-10T00:35:01.662+0000)

And that's kinda silly.

Also, it doesn't actually show up in previews which is a sad.

> * If the quote / reply is made in Chronological view it will transfer (properly threaded) into Discussion view

But... what if I reply to multiple people in the same post? Will the same post exist multiple times in Discussion View, under each reply that it belongs to? 

Because imo the biggest asset of having a functional quote and reply system is the fact that you can respond to multiple people at once, which significantly reduces the size of the thread for anybody in chronological view.

> * Visual updates to make it clear and less obnoxious

And also harder to tell if something is in a quote as opposed to having both manual and formatting-based indents. Wasn't there a discussion earlier about how quotes should be somehow highlighted?

-
I maintain, as I have always believed, that simply stapling chronological features onto Reddit (which is similar to what has been done here even if that is not at all how it came about) is a terrible way to manage a forum.

It spawns tons of one-line comments that do nothing but make the people using vbulletin-view have to read tons and tons of nothing, constantly loading extra pages (which you can't open in multiple tabs **still**, WHY, exactly was that decided?!); and the people using reddit-view don't actually see any of the vbulletin-view posters because they're not properly nested (as they usually respond to more than one person).

Thus you, despite having one... THING, have two completely different groups of people responding in a thread. Very few people in reddit-view quote because the context for their post is above due to how nesting works, which makes everybody in chronological lost. As above, people trying to join a standing discussion that use reddit-view will not see hardly any, IF any, of the chronological multi-replies because they don't scroll down.

\*sigh\* But that is neither here nor there, I'm elated to have quotes that have more function.
